column9: I have been taking Aggrenox since Feb 2008. I have had a small TIA.   With in a month had a strange left side of head sensation.  Felt like a warm hand on my head.  In time a stronger feeling but sensation would come and go. 6 Months later I thought maybe I could stretch them out so skipped a bit. Woke up with another Tia. Doctors blamed it on "I didn't take pill faithfully.   I was to take them everyday they said.  MY only complain other than the headache which my doctor and neurolgist said "Don't worry" about is they cost so darn much. Anywhere from $200. for a 30 day supply to $600. for a 90 day. Also another problem I have, is drug stores around my area don't carry the item. The  store has to order it which makes me wonder what  other people in my area who might have Tias   take?

column1: Prevention of Blood Clots in the Brain
column2: Patient Experience, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: It has been 6 weeks since I started on Aggrenox after an ischemic stroke. The side effects have been horrible. At first I thought the stroke was causing my terrible feelings, but now I am off Aggrenox and not taking any drugs - no more side effects except the horrible residual heartburn - it's sometimes hardly bearable even with different prescription or non-prescription antacids. The bad headaches and severe nausea were initial problems even with taking only 1 per day for the first week. Now I hope that the severe heartburn will heal. I need 2-3 more weeks on antacids - I hope the heartburn is not permanent! I was also on Crestor, only 5 mg/day and it was causing me myalgia/asthenia - also a horrible feeling, and it was getting worse. I initially thought it was due to the stroke - as a patient one depends so much on the medical "professionals" but they only know so much - going by published information and generalized percentages for efficacy. They don't go through the side effects! Generally, I have a very negative outcome from, and view of, prescribed medications. It's like the medical profession uses medications when there are no easy answers - it's easy to write a prescription, but they should be more sensitive to patients with severe side effects. The patient is at the mercy of the doctor who prescribes the medication.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I had stroke (bi-lat), very rare. Dr started me on aggrenox (2xdy) until they could determine cause of stroke (clot or other, hemorrage ruled out).  Four hours after taking first pill, developed severe headache which lasted 7 hours (felt like someone inside my head hitting it with sledge hammer over&over). Groggy & achy next day. Tried pill in am and achy/groggy with moderate headache throughout day.  Took 2nd dose in evening.  Headache started 3 hours later and lasted 6 hours. Excructiating pain in head.  Any movenment of head or neck set off a 5 minute period of pain like I have never felt before.  I had to lie flat, no pillow and not move at all.  On a scale of 1-10, I would rate the pain 9.5-10.  I felt like I was being tortured. After 6 hours, pain was at a 6.  I spent 2 hours applying ice cubes directly to my head, neck, face over & over. Ice alleviated pain to just a moderate headache.Headache is listed as a side effect but this was no ordinary headache, I could not get up, could not reach for a glass of water next to bed, could not move.  Very similar but much more intense than headaches I had after spinal block for child birth.  Doctor switched me to Plavix for time being until they can determine if clot caused problem.  Reading other views made me realized I should have been given more info on side effects; glad I'm off of it.

column2: FJSibr, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Had two apparent TIA's about 6 years apart. Experienced a strong burning sensation on the entire left side of my bady. Much like rubbing alcohol, only magnify the sensation by 5 times or more, that was what I felt Dr. kept twisting my arm to take something. Have had diarrhea with Aggrenox, and this was while only taking 1 dose per day. Also concentration problems, light headedness, feel like I will pass out at times. Blood pressure at Dr. office was 130/90. Experienced rapid heartbeat. Dr. was so concerned he sent me to a cardiologist. Had a echo cardiogram, was normal. Wore a heart monitor for 48 hours. Still waiting for the results. I think this med. is the culprit. Was on Plavix before for only 2 weeks. Had a severe reaction, i.e. itching, difficulty swallowing, broke out with welts all over my body. Was given a steroid shot, and told to take a double dose of Benedryl to alleviate symptoms. Then severe shoulder and joint pain in upper body for several days. About ready to fire my neurologist.

column9: Medication was initiated on 4/3/09 after a brain stem stroke, small 3 mm. Aggrenox produced headaches daily. After Web MD recommendation not to lie down at least 30 min after taking he has not had any headaches. I don't let him lie down for close to an hour or sit at the computer using his eyes and upper body. No where else did I find that lying down was a no-no. Even in the hospital. Thank you for the warning. No other side effects noted except fo dry mouth, which is treatable. Web MD is great!  Thanks for your support in this world today where one needs to be informed.  I'm his wife a retired RN/ANP  Jeanne T.

column9: Had a stoke Sept. 2008 Took 2 caps a day for 5 months. Suffered headaches, fast heart beat, very painful sensitive skin, sever stomach acid, and athritic pain in both wrist, neck and left knee.  Never had pain before. Stopped taking medication and most cleared up immediately except for right knee. Had cortizone which made it worse.  Was on a walker for several weeks. Had a series of shots in my knee for 3 weeks. Am now waiting to see how the shots work or I will need to have knee replacement surgery.  I had never had a problem with my knee before.  I will never take this medication again.  Wish I had never started it.  I take asprin now and Doctors have said that it is just as good. I personally think the medication can be one of the worst things I have ever taken.

column1: Prevention of Blood Clots in the Brain
column2: Wayne, 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I originally had 1 possible TIA (9 months ago during some strenuous work at home). I started only 1 capsule per day to get used to the drug. Use in the morning gave me a migraine headache at work and I had to go home the first 2 days. I then switched to evening use of 1 capsule. Migraines started 2 hrs. after use each evening and continued for exactly 5 hours each night so that I could not sleep during that time. Then, after 6 nights, the migraine only lasted 4 hours. The next 2 nights I had no headaches and was able to sleep, so I began to add a capsule in the morning as well (so that I was taking a full dose each 24-hr. period). I had a mild headache in the daytime for about 2 days when I switched to the full dose, and then they went away. I have not had anything other than a very mild headache at times since then. I've even inadvertently skipped a capsule with no side affects. (I do recommend eating right before taking the drug to avoid side effects.)  Also, no other TIAs or problems. I've had no problems with excessive bleeding when I get a nick or a small cut and no excessive bruising. I also take Lipitor and some asthma medications. Blessings to all.

column9: This drug is highly effective.   At first however, it has some pronounced side effects mostly headache.   This makes sense because the idea is to dilate arteries which induces a two week long migraine headache.   The side effects are transitory and in some respects prove out the medication's effectiveness.   When having some dental work the dentist noticed pronounced bleeding.    This is also a sign the drug is effective.     Presently I have no side effects from this medication and feel that it has positive benefits.

column1: Prevention of Blood Clots in the Brain
column2: Frustrated Grandfather hopeing to get better now., 75 or over Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: BEWARE OF THIS MEDICATION! I had been taking this since a T.I.A. a year ago.  I have sufferred the whole year with uncontrolled blood pressure including orthostatic hypotension.(low blood pressure upon standing or exercise-90/35)Also sufferred from Syncope-passing out.  My blood pressure was so low after taking this medictation that I no longer took cozaar and norvasc that I had been taking prior to the T.I.A. This medication has aspirin and dipyridamole.  I was told by pharmacist that dipyridamole is anti platelet sticking medication.  Actually it is a vasodilator which can cause light-headedness or very low blood pressure upon standing in the elderly.  I have lost a whole year of recovery due to not being able to exercise due to such low blood pressure.  Physical therapists were afraid to work with me.  Shame on all the doctors (8) that missed this and pharmacist as well.  Since I have been off this medication (two weeks)I have started back on blood pressure medication and my blood pressure is gradually becoming more stable.  I am now on plavix as well.  I hope this helps someone else.

column9: I HAD TWO MINI-STROKES WITH SEIZURES, DOC IS TRYING AGGRENOX. STILL HAVE TINGLING IN RT. ARM AND LEG. GOT HEADACHES WHEN STARTED BUT WENT AWAY. SEEMS TO BE WORKING SO FAR BUT ONLY BEEN ON IT 6 WKS. GOOD LUCK TO ALL!

column1: Prevention of Blood Clots in the Brain
column2: kat2nice, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: I have been taking aggrenox for one and a half years since they discovered i had two TIA's and at first my arms were so heavy. I had a lot of headaches and overall didnt feel well but after about 2-3 weeks i was back to normal. I had to stop taking it for surgery for 1 week but was fine once i resumed it. i would strongly recommend sticking it out because the risk is higher than anything else.

column9: After a mild stroke, I have been taking aggrenox and lipitor.  I have felt tired and without ambition or motivation.  My sense of taste has changed making many foods distasteful.

column1: Prevention of Blood Clots in the Brain
column2: agalloway, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Only been on it 2 weeks.  As long as I take it with a full glass of water and sit up at least 30 minutes after taking, no headache or nausea.  I hope this will work cause I have had 4 TIA in the last two weeks (and two strokes, one last year, one five years ago).

column1: Other
column9: i have used aggrenox for 2 years since my stroke and i had no side effects and hopefully is working for me i have no choice but to take it, a stroke is a very serious problem

column1: Prevention of Blood Clots in the Brain
column2: gqab51@verizon.net, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Have only been using for three weeks.  Skin very dry and itchy, more so than usual.  Still havit tia's, but not as frequent.Have pain in neck around Carotid area, but have been dopplered in my last hospital stay when the put me on Aggrenox.  Having problem with swelling in hands and face, with some tingling sensation, enough to make me uncomfortable while trying to sleep.  Do not exercise much, but do work on my feet all day, with condition of PAD, and bone spurs on little toe joints which are very painful.
